E is on side AC, and F is on side AB.
EG is perpendicular to AC, intersecting BC at G.
D is the midpoint of CG.

When light reflects off a surface, the angle of incidence equals the angle of reflection.
At E, the light undergoes regular reflection, and at F, it undergoes total internal reflection.
